Le jeu est une chimÃ¨re rien de plus

Un jeu assemblÃ© Ã  la va vite en 1 mois quand on a vu que le PVE allait pas marcher, on ressort des tiroirs les quelques persos sur lesquels on avait taffÃ© avant l'arrÃªt du suivi et Ã§a fera l'affaire.

J'aimerais Ãªtre dans le monde ou overwatch est un bon jeu mais ce n'est pas le cas. L'Ã©quilibrage est hasardeux, la direction du jeu pas claire (on se demande souvent si le jeu veut Ãªtre un shooter ou non)  rien ne va passÃ© les 50 premiÃ¨res heures. Le jeu semble avoir oublier que la plupart de son public aime... s'amuser. Trop de counterpicks trop de strat facile Ã  abuse avec du reward dÃ©mesurÃ© bref pour s'amuser faut que les Ã©toiles s'alignent.
En 2016 Ã§a passait, c'Ã©tait nouveau on faisait outre les points faible. Aujourd'hui le teamwork requis pour contrer certains personnage me paraÃ®t Ãªtre un vrai frein au fun, sans parler des perso type Junkrat qui forcent le counterpick, ce qui est amusant ni pour aucun des deux joueurs. 

Dommage car les devs ont du talent mais de grosses erreurs dans la maniÃ¨re dont les dirigeants exploitent ce talent.

Overwatch 2 on Steam is a sad last fart for this franchise. And it's obvious since after all the effort Activision Blizzard made to force Battlenet down our throats, releasing it on Steam is clearly one desperate attempt to bump the popularity of the game among a crowd that won't even leave their bedroom to take a shower, so why would they leave steam to play this sorry excuse for a sequel? 

The game is fun nonetheless. If you never played it, give it a try. There are hundreds of hours of extremely well polished gameplay mechanics, amazing sound design, a great roster as rule 34 starter kit, and a couple of extra game modes too, really fun stuff. If you are an O.G OW player. You now the drill: Give it a shot, have a deep breath, and call su1c1d3 watch.

Overwatch 1 was a great game. Unfortunately it was removed and downgraded to Overwatch "2". The gameplay is still fun and the new characters add interesting abilities. However, the microtransactions are horribly overpriced. Content that was previously free must now be grinded for or bought. Even new characters are locked behind this system. And the new PvE content (which was initially the reason for creating OW2), is the same gameplay loop as the old archives missions. According to reviews, even the new paid story missions are the same boring gameplay loop. Overwatch 2 does nothing to innovate and only exists to show Blizzard's greed for money.

Purchased Overwatch 1 way back then. What did old players get as a reward when the devs made the game F2P? Clown Sombra skin, because that's what they think their players are.

To say the least, Blizzard has no respect for you or your time. They want your money and they're going to milk this game until every last penny has been squeezed out of it. Do not give them a cent.

It's Overwatch. You know what you're getting.
If you wanted to play on Steam Deck this makes it easier, and you don't have to install Battle.net either, so if that bugged you, go for it.

A shell of its former self. The design team is the only one keeping this game together.

The invasion update is the final nail in the coffin. Absolutely soulless with no replayability, they even had the audacity to stagger the varied versions (Mystery Heroes) of the free PvE mission.

This game really does look good, but everything has been surface level glitter since October 2022.
Play the game, enjoy it with your friends, but spend your money elsewhere.

yo juego Overwatch 2, siempre he sido tanque y siempre discuto con mis compaÃ±eros que son medicos, osea los que curan.
pues mis compaÃ±eros, los que se supone tienen que curar hacen otras cosas, no entienden que la unica clase que importa es el tanque, los demas no importan, porque con los tanques se ganan las partidas.
los que somos buenos tenemos que soportar que en una partida nos toque un equipo de novatos que no cumplen los objetivos, y que por culpa de ellos terminamos perdiendo la partida; entonces no es justo, que a pesar que uno se esfuerza tanto en una partida, terminemos perdiendo por culpa del equipo, el cual no cumplio los objetivos y por eso terminamos enojados y estresados.

Fast alle negativen Rezensionen hier, sind purer Hass auf Blizzard wegen ihrer Monetarisierungsstrategie. Man kann das auch absolut verstehen, Blizzard ist zu einem Synonym fÃ¼r Gier geworden. Diablo Immortal und Diablo 4 sind eine Katastrophe! 
Das hat aber nichts mit Overwatch zu tun und diese Rezensionen werden Overwatch nicht gerecht. Man muss die Storykampagne nicht spielen, das hat absolut keinen Einfluss auf das eigentliche Multiplayer-Overwatch wie wir es schon seit vielen Jahren lieb gewonnen haben. Also bitte ignoriert die Wut und Cancel-Culture vieler Rezensenten, denn das Spiel ist einfach genial. Kein anderes MMO-FPS hat es geschafft mich so viele Jahre zu fesseln und kein anderes Spiel schafft es, mich so die Zeit vergessen zu lassen. Die Runden sind fordernd, extrem spannend und jede Runde ist anders. Der Battlepass motiviert, auch wenn man nicht zahlen mÃ¶chte. Aber es ist ein "Game as a service", also kann man auch ab und zu etwas zurÃ¼ckgeben fÃ¼r die vielen geilen Stunden die man in dem Spiel verbringt, oder? Blizzard investiert viel Zeit in neue Skins, Karten, das Balancing, neue Helden, eSport, etc. Ich bin absolut kein Fan von F2P, durch diesen Trend sind auch diese ganzen negativen Kommentare hier entstanden. Das wichtigste bei Overwatch2 ist aber, kein P2W und die Preise fÃ¼r den Battle Pass gehen in Ordnung.
Der Release auf Steam ist einfach genial, mit dem Blizzard Account anmelden, fertig. Alle Einstellungen (inkl. Grafik), die Progression inkl. detaillierter Statistik seit dem Release von Overwatch 1, alles ist da, top!
Ja, fÃ¼r Wiedereinsteiger die von Overwatch 1 kommen, ist es erstmal sehr gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig mit 5 Helden und nur einem Tank. Doch schon nach kurzer Zeit merkt man, dass diese Aenderungen absolut Sinn machen. Das Spiel ist dadurch noch actionreicher und abwechselnder geworden, diese Neuerungen sind also absolut gelungen!

its a really fun game and its very addictive 


however 
the company is scummy with them not delivering on promises. play it if you want but don't buy the invasion stuff, blizzard shouldn't be paid to put out a half assed version of what they said they would

I have played this game on and off since 2016. The recent management of PVE, their bad office culture that allegedly led to a female staff member sadly ending her own life are all parts off my increasing amount of hatred for this game and their management. 

Then the game came out I loved it and played it quiet alot, but in it's state and frankly the state it has been in since OW2 was announced is not a game I can nor will ever recommend to anyone. What I presume to be the upper-management has transformed a once great game into a machine made to suck all your money and enjoyment of the game out of you. From Battle Passes to locking heroes away behind a pay wall and making the long anticipated PvE mode behind a paywall just to earn a bit of money short term. Some people might deny this but the fact that this game has even moved to Steam is proof of how badly it has been treated by thous making decisions.

I feel bad for the truly passionate and dedicated talents that have worked under the aforementioned office culture and terrible management of what seems to have started out as a passion project from a large and talented team from Blizzard then it was at it's best.
Roses are red, violets are blue everyone should give this greedy company a bad review.
Era uma vez, um jogo bom ;-;
This game is the reason why TF2 doesn't have the heavy update
